column4: how can I get something like a list of installed packages (not necessarily versions and all) and use that on another installation of ubuntu?
on the other machine, dpkg --set-selections < mypackagelist && apt-get dselect-upgrade
yes, it will use the list from the chrooted root
you missed the last part, sudo apt-get dselect-upgrade
I've done it several times, are you sure you have the right package list?
apt-get update won't work after chroot
you don't really need to update, since you only want a list of packages that are already there.
I want to install them now...
what was the error? you need both dev and proc mounted for that, i believe
I just did that... but it won't work... I'll doublecheck now...
indeed, though I realized DNS was the defunct part just before he said I needed resolv.conf
